services.title: LVAD Performance Validation
services.description: Left ventricular assist devices sustaining cardiac output face unique challenges validating pump durability while preventing thrombosis and hemolysis complications. We evaluate continuous-flow performance using pressure-volume loop analysis and ventricular function monitoring that captures device-heart interaction throughout cardiac cycles. Mock circulation systems replicate failing heart conditions while hemocompatibility protocols quantify hemolysis indices, platelet activation, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 adapted for rotary blood pumps. Our GLP-compliant protocols support PMA pathways for Class III life-sustaining devices across bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy applications.

services.title: TAVR Deployment Characterization
services.description: Transcatheter aortic valve replacement requires proving deployment precision across varying anatomies while preventing paravalvular leak in heavily calcified annuli. We test valve expansion dynamics using high-resolution fluoroscopy and transesophageal echocardiography that capture positioning stability throughout cardiac cycles. Pulse duplicator systems measure hemodynamic performance against ISO 5840 standards while accelerated durability protocols simulate 200-400 million cycles. Whether validating balloon-expandable or self-expanding platforms, our protocols address both PMA requirements for breakthrough technologies and 510(k) pathways demonstrating substantial equivalence to established predicates.

services.title: Drug-Eluting Stent Validation
services.description: Combination products integrating device mechanics with pharmaceutical delivery face regulatory coordination between CDRH and CDER review centers. We characterize drug release kinetics using HPLC analysis while measuring tissue uptake that determines antiproliferative effectiveness in vessel walls. Polymer coating assessment utilizes scanning electron microscopy identifying uniformity across stent struts while vascular healing studies track endothelialization progression through standardized histomorphometry. Our protocols support both 510(k) pathways comparing to predicate devices and PMA submissions for novel drug-polymer combinations requiring comprehensive safety demonstration.
